paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the role of the KCNH2 gene in Long QT Syndrome (LQTS) and the potential of hERG channel activators as a therapeutic strategy. It mentions several variants in the KCNH2 gene associated with LQT2 but does not provide detailed penetrance data or individual case studies.

functional_data.summary: Corrects for effects of trafficking deficient LQT2-associated R56Q hERG.

variants.source_location: Main text, section on hERG channel activators
key_quotes: cLQTS: corrects for effects of trafficking deficient LQT2-associated R56Q hERG.

functional_data.summary: ICA-105574 could activate both the LQT2-associated hERG mutants N470D and G601S.

variants.source_location: Main text, section on hERG channel activators
key_quotes: ICA-105574 could activate both the LQT2-associated hERG mutants N470D and G601S but with threefold reduced potency compared with WT.

functional_data.summary: ICA-105574 could activate both the LQT2-associated hERG mutants N470D and G601S.

variants.source_location: Main text, section on hERG channel activators
key_quotes: ICA-105574 could activate both the LQT2-associated hERG mutants N470D and G601S but with threefold reduced potency compared with WT.

functional_data.summary: Effective against the variant of uncertain significance (VUS) KCNH2 T983I.

variants.source_location: Main text, section on hERG channel activators
key_quotes: Effective against the variant of uncertain significance (VUS) KCNH2 T983I.

challenges: The paper did not provide detailed penetrance data or individual case studies.
extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction focused on variants mentioned in the context of hERG channel activators and their potential therapeutic effects.
